sen.j: 淳和天皇が退位に伴ない淳和院離宮（別名西院・この付近の地名である西院の由来となった）へ居を移すに際し、天長10年（833年）にその守護社として創建された。
sen.e: Saiin Kasuga-jinja Shrine was founded as a guardian shrine for the Junna-in Villa (also named "Sai-in" and the origin of the name of the local area) into which Emperor Junna moved when he ascended to the throne.

sen.e: This grand festival takes place on the second Sunday in October and features a parade of two portable shrines (each weighing approximately 2 tonnes) and five kenboko (decorated spear-like poles) accompanied by shrine parishioners, local residents and a drum and fife band.
